newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit recovers slightly, seen rangebound.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit recovers slightly, seen rangebound.

text.p: The ringgit stayed in a tight range in early Asian trading after recovering slightly from overnight fall, dealers said.
Ringgit movements are expected to remain tight through the day due to lack of demand, they said, adding the dollar's recovery against the majors would also limit ringgit's upside.

"Demand for ringgit has not been strong and that's why it has not moved higher despite the dollar's fall," said a dealer with a European bank. "There's still a bit of covering of short dollar positions this morning."
But dealers said the dollar's topside was likely to be capped at 2.5150/60, the level Bank Negara Malaysia last intervened at.
At 0200 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5107/17 a dollar after reaching a low of 2.5125 in European trading overnight and against 2.5085/95 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Monday.
